description:
Your task is to implement two Python functions: mark_task_complete() and filter_tasks_by_status(). These functions should:

  • mark_task_complete(): Mark a task as complete by setting its completed attribute to True. Search for the task by title or ID.
  • filter_tasks_by_status(): Filter tasks based on their completed status (True or False).

Use the following templates to implement these functions.
code_stub:
def mark_task_complete(task_list, task_id):
    # Find task by title or ID and mark it as complete
    pass

def filter_tasks_by_status(task_list, status):
    # Filter tasks by their completion status
    pass
correct_code:
def mark_task_complete(task_list, task_id):
    for task in task_list:
        if task.title == task_id:  # Replace with task ID if applicable
            task.mark_as_complete()
            print(f"Task '{task_id}' marked as complete.")
            return True
    print(f"Error: Task with title '{task_id}' not found!")
    return False

def filter_tasks_by_status(task_list, status):
    return [task for task in task_list if task.completed == status]
expected_output:
Task 'Complete Homework' marked as complete.
Error: Task with title 'NonExistentTask' not found!
Filtered Tasks (Completed): ['Complete Homework']
Filtered Tasks (Incomplete): ['Buy Groceries']
